meanings.definition: A type of white blood cell that engulfs and digests cellular debris, foreign substances, microbes, cancer cells, and anything else that does not have the types of proteins specific to healthy body cells.
meanings.sent1: The macrophage helped clean up the mess in the body by eating up the harmful invaders.
meanings.sent2: Doctors studied the macrophage to understand how it fights off infections.
meanings.sent3: The macrophage was like a tiny vacuum cleaner, sucking up all the bad stuff in its path.
meanings.sent4: In the war against illness, the macrophage was the fearless soldier on the front lines.
meanings.sent5: The macrophage was like a superhero, protecting the body from harm with its incredible powers.

meanings.definition: A large phagocytic cell found in stationary form in the tissues or as a mobile white blood cell, especially at sites of infection.
meanings.sent1: At the site of infection, the macrophage was on high alert, ready to defend the body.
meanings.sent2: The macrophage moved swiftly through the tissues, seeking out harmful intruders.
meanings.sent3: The macrophage was like a vigilant guardian, always watching over the body's health.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against disease, the macrophage was the valiant protector of the body.
meanings.sent5: The macrophage was like a brave knight, fighting off the enemies of health with courage.
